alert.note: Alert for Creek; Pawnee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 13 at 11:04PM CDT until August 14 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, Creek, Mayes, Osage, Pawnee, Rogers, Tulsa and Washington OK. * WHEN...Until 100 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1104 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tulsa... Sand Springs... Claremore... Owasso... Skiatook... Collinsville... Mannford... Chelsea... Sperry... Oologah... Adair... Foyil... Westport... Talala... Vera... Tulsa International Airport... Turley... Walnut Creek State Park... Keystone State Park... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
